name: Jaeger Schnitzel
author: Helene Rose-Carson
summary: This is wonderful. Breaded and fried cubed pork with mushrooms and hunter gravy over a bed of noodles. Serve with a salad and a hunk of thick crusty bread.
ingredients: 3 (1 ounce) packages dry mushroom gravy mix
directions: Pound out cubed pork, and cut in half
Heat oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat
Dip pork in egg, then bread crumbs, and place in hot oil
Prepare gravy mix according to package directions
Stir in mushrooms, and cook with gravy
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add the egg noodles, and cook until al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes; drain
Serve pork over noodles and smother with gravy
